DataElement.preferredName: CARS 2 How Upset About Possibility of Breast Cancer Recurrence Score 6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much the possibility that their breast cancer could recur upsets them, using a 6 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concerns About Recurrence Scale How Upset About Possibility of Breast Cancer Recurrence Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A scale designed to systematically assess the extent and nature of a woman's fears about the possibility of breast cancer recurrence._A question about how much the possibility that their breast cancer could recur upsets an individual._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A scale designed to systematically assess the extent and nature of a woman's fears about the possibility of breast cancer recurrence.

Concepts.definition: A scale designed to systematically assess the extent and nature of a woman's fears about the possibility of breast cancer recurrence.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Upset Likert Scale Score 6 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A scale for the subjective scoring of upset that ranges from 1: It does not upset me at all to 6: It makes me extremely upset.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response of 5 on a scale for the subject scoring of upset that ranges from 1: It does not upset me at all to 6: It makes me extremely upset.

Concepts.definition: A response of 5 on a scale for the subject scoring of upset that ranges from 1: It does not upset me at all to 6: It makes me extremely upset.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response of 4 on a scale for the subject scoring of upset that ranges from 1: It does not upset me at all to 6: It makes me extremely upset.

Concepts.definition: A response of 4 on a scale for the subject scoring of upset that ranges from 1: It does not upset me at all to 6: It makes me extremely upset.

Concepts.definition: A response of 2 on a scale for the subject scoring of upset that ranges from 1: It does not upset me at all to 6: It makes me extremely upset.

Concepts.definition: A response of 6 on a scale for the subject scoring of upset that ranges from 1: It does not upset me at all to 6: It makes me extremely upset.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.

ReferenceDocuments.name: How much does the possibility
ReferenceDocuments.description: How much does the possibility that your breast cancer could recur upset you?

DataElement.origin: CARS: Concerns About Recurrence Scale, Suzanne M. Johnson Vickberg, Ph.D., Ann Behav Med 2003
